parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string. Constraints: Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens. The first character must be a letter. Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens. Example: mydbinstance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The compute and memory capacity of the instance; for example, db.r5.large.

parameters.name: Engine
parameters.description: The name of the database engine to be used for this instance. Valid value: docdb.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone that the instance is created in. Default: A random, system-chosen Availability Zone in the endpoint's Amazon Web Services Region. Example: us-east-1d.

parameters.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
parameters.description: The time range each week during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time for each Amazon Web Services Region, occurring on a random day of the week. Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.

parameters.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: This parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB does not perform minor version upgrades regardless of the value set. Default: false.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to be assigned to the instance. You can assign up to 10 tags to an instance. (dict) --- Metadata assigned to an Amazon DocumentDB resource consisting of a key-value pair. Key (string) --- The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with ' aws:' or ' rds:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$'). Value (string) --- The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with ' aws:' or ' rds:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with ' aws:' or ' rds:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with ' aws:' or ' rds:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

parameters.name: DBClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the cluster that the instance will belong to.

parameters.name: PromotionTier
parameters.description: A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance. Default: 1 Valid values: 0-15

parameters.name: PerformanceInsightsKMSKeyId
parameters.description: The KMS key identifier for encryption of Performance Insights data. The KMS key identifier is the key ARN, key ID, alias ARN, or alias name for the KMS key. If you do not specify a value for PerformanceInsightsKMSKeyId, then Amazon DocumentDB uses your default KMS key. There is a default KMS key for your Amazon Web Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default KMS key for each Amazon Web Services region.

parameters.name: CACertificateIdentifier
parameters.description: The CA certificate identifier to use for the DB instance's server certificate. For more information, see Updating Your Amazon DocumentDB TLS Certificates and Encrypting Data in Transit in the Amazon DocumentDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: DBInstance
nested_items.description: Detailed information about an instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Contains a user-provided database identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies an instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceClass
nested_items.description: Contains the name of the compute and memory capacity class of the instance.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies the current state of this database.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: Specifies the DNS address of the instance.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: HostedZoneId
nested_items.description: Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.

nested_items.name: InstanceCreateTime
nested_items.description: Provides the date and time that the instance was created.

nested_items.name: PreferredBackupWindow
nested_items.description: Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the BackupRetentionPeriod.

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are retained.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: Provides a list of VPC security group elements that the instance belongs to.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Availability Zone that the instance is located in.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroup
nested_items.description: Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the instance, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet group.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the subnet group.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroupDescription
nested_items.description: Provides the description of the subnet group.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: Provides the virtual private cloud (VPC) ID of the subnet group.

nested_items.name: SubnetGroupStatus
nested_items.description: Provides the status of the subnet group.

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: Detailed information about one or more subnets within a subnet group.

nested_items.name: SubnetIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the identifier of the subnet.

nested_items.name: SubnetAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: Specifies the Availability Zone for the subnet.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: SubnetStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of the subnet.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB subnet group.

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: Specifies that changes to the instance are pending. This element is included only when changes are pending. Specific changes are identified by subelements.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceClass
nested_items.description: Contains the new DBInstanceClass for the instance that will be applied or is currently being applied.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: Contains the new AllocatedStorage size for then instance that will be applied or is currently being applied.

nested_items.name: MasterUserPassword
nested_items.description: Contains the pending or currently in-progress change of the master credentials for the instance.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Specifies the pending port for the instance.

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: Specifies the pending number of days for which automated backups are retained.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: Indicates that the Single-AZ instance is to change to a Multi-AZ deployment.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: Indicates the database engine version.

nested_items.name: LicenseModel
nested_items.description: The license model for the instance.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: Specifies the new Provisioned IOPS value for the instance that will be applied or is currently being applied.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Contains the new DBInstanceIdentifier for the instance that will be applied or is currently being applied.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: Specifies the storage type to be associated with the instance.

nested_items.name: CACertificateIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the identifier of the certificate authority (CA) certificate for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroupName
nested_items.description: The new subnet group for the instance.

nested_items.name: PendingCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: A list of the log types whose configuration is still pending. These log types are in the process of being activated or deactivated.

nested_items.name: LogTypesToEnable
nested_items.description: Log types that are in the process of being deactivated. After they are deactivated, these log types aren't exported to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LogTypesToDisable
nested_items.description: Log types that are in the process of being enabled. After they are enabled, these log types are exported to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LatestRestorableTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: Indicates the database engine version.

nested_items.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: Does not apply. This parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB does not perform minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.

nested_items.name: PubliclyAccessible
nested_items.description: Not supported. Amazon DocumentDB does not currently support public endpoints. The value of PubliclyAccessible is always false.

nested_items.name: StatusInfos
nested_items.description: The status of a read replica. If the instance is not a read replica, this is blank.

nested_items.name: StatusType
nested_items.description: This value is currently ' read replication.'

nested_items.name: Normal
nested_items.description: A Boolean value that is true if the instance is operating normally, or false if the instance is in an error state.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Status of the instance. For a StatusType of read replica, the values can be replicating, error, stopped, or terminated.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Details of the error if there is an error for the instance. If the instance is not in an error state, this value is blank.

nested_items.name: DBClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: Contains the name of the cluster that the instance is a member of if the instance is a member of a cluster.

nested_items.name: StorageEncrypted
nested_items.description: Specifies whether or not the instance is encrypted.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: If StorageEncrypted is true, the KMS key identifier for the encrypted instance.

nested_items.name: DbiResourceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region-unique, immutable identifier for the instance. This identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for the instance is accessed.

nested_items.name: CACertificateIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the CA certificate for this DB instance.

nested_items.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether to copy tags from the DB instance to snapshots of the DB instance. By default, tags are not copied.

nested_items.name: PromotionTier
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the instance.

nested_items.name: EnabledCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: A list of log types that this instance is configured to export to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CertificateDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: CAIdentifier
nested_items.description: The CA identifier of the CA certificate used for the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: ValidTill
nested_items.description: The expiration date of the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsEnabled
nested_items.description: Set to true if Amazon RDS Performance Insights is enabled for the DB instance, and otherwise false.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsKMSKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key identifier for encryption of Performance Insights data. The KMS key ID is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), KMS key identifier, or the KMS key alias for the KMS encryption key.
